name: Auto-sampler
description: This algorithm allows you to automatically create multi-sampled instruments in a format that can be used by the Poly Multisample algorithm, by triggering an external synth (by MIDI or CV/gate) and recording the resulting audio. You can set the range of notes to be sampled, and the step size (e.g., every note, every fourth note etc.). You can also choose to sample multiple velocity levels per note, and multiple round-robins of each note. The samples are stored on the MicroSD card in a folder within the root 'samples' folder.
use_cases: Creating multi-sampled instruments for hardware or software synthesis
Recording external synth responses to MIDI/CV input
Generating round-robin samples for dynamic playing
Sampling velocity layers for expressive performance
Testing and adjusting latency in audio recording
gui_description: While sampling, the display shows a level meter, the filename of the sample currently being recorded, elapsed time, and a gauge indicating MicroSD card pressure. The interface also visualizes latency measurement during test mode.

parameters.name: Bit depth
parameters.description: Chooses the bit depth for recording. The options are 16, 24, or 32 bit.

parameters.name: Normalization
parameters.description: Sets the input voltage that corresponds to full-scale in the recorded files. The options are 10V or 12V.

parameters.name: Note Step
parameters.description: The number of notes to increment by after each sample (e.g., '1' samples every note, '12' samples every octave etc.).

parameters.name: Vel switches
parameters.description: The number of velocity switch layers to sample.

parameters.name: Max velocity
parameters.description: The maximum velocity value to use when sampling with velocity switch layers, or the fixed value to use if not using velocity switches.

parameters.name: Round robins
parameters.description: The number of round-robins to sample.

parameters.name: Length
parameters.description: The note length (i.e., how long the gate is held high, or between MIDI note on and note off).

parameters.name: Gap
parameters.description: The time to keep recording after the note is released.

parameters.name: Latency
parameters.description: Adjusts for latency. When you activate the Test note, the module listens for incoming audio and measures the delay (latency) between generating the note (sending MIDI or outputting a gate) and receiving audio.

parameters.name: Preview note
parameters.description: Sets the MIDI note number to use when previewing.

parameters.name: Test
parameters.description: When on, triggers a note so you can test the timing parameters (Length and Gap) and the latency.

input_ports.name: Left/mono input
input_ports.description: The left channel or mono audio input to record.

input_ports.name: Right input
input_ports.description: The right channel audio input for stereo recording (if applicable).

input_ports.name: Left/mono input
input_ports.description: The left channel or mono input to record.

input_ports.name: Right input
input_ports.description: The right channel input, if recording in stereo.

output_ports.name: CV output
output_ports.description: Pitch CV output bus, used to trigger external synths.

output_ports.name: Gate output
output_ports.description: Gate output bus, controlling note duration on external synths.
